content.rendered:
The district is committed to enhancing our educational facilities through long-term planning, and the ongoing legacy capital project represents a significant step in this endeavor. To prepare for the next phase of this project, which will be presented to voters for approval in May 2025, the district formed a Legacy Referendum Advisory Committee. This committee, comprised of representatives from all eight school buildings, played an important role in providing input as the district developed the scope of the future of its school buildings.

  • March 20 – Introduction, Overview & Financial
  • April 10 – Scope Review: 5 Yr. Capital Plan, Classroom, etc.
  • April 24 – Building Specific Scope Items
  • May 8 – Building Tours – Session #1
  • May 15 – Building Tours – Session #2
  • June 5 – Prioritization  |  Committee Scope Priority List
  • July 10 – Review Prioritization & Goals
  • August 14 – Draft Board of Education Presentation
  • September 18– Finalize Board of Education Presentation
  • October 24 – Board of Education Presentation

Advisory Committee Members

  • Bill McMordie – Construction Manager at Saratoga Project Management
  • John Onderdonk, Architect at Mosaic Associates
  • Matthew Gaspary, Architect at Mosaic Associates
  • John Ellis, Board of Education Trustee
  • Dean Kolligian, Board of Education Trustee
  • Connie Woytowich, Board of Education Trustee
  • Mike Patton, Superintendent of Schools
  • David L’Hommedieu, Assistant Superintendent IT and Operations
  • Lucas Manny, IT Support Specialist
  • Bobby Yusko, Assistant Superintendent for Business
  • Lisa Cutting, Assistant Supt. of 21st Century Teaching & Learning
  • Danielle Bouton-Wales,  Director of K-12 STEM and Secondary Instruction
  • John Goodson,  Director of Athletics, Physical Education, & Health
  • John Thuener, Director of Facilities and Operations
  • Michelle Tsao, Principal at Saratoga Springs High School
  • Kevin Wolpert, Assistant Principal at Saratoga Springs High School
  • Christopher Conley,  Teacher at Saratoga Springs High School
  • Katherine Cole, Teacher at Saratoga Springs High School
  • Christine  Taber,  Parent/guardian representative for Saratoga Springs High School
  • Michael Panetta, Parent/guardian representative for Saratoga Springs High School
  • Scott Singer, Principal at Maple Avenue Middle School
  • Joshua Muldner, School Counselor at Maple Avenue Middle School
  • Raymond Harrington, Teacher at Maple Avenue Middle School
  • Leah Seager, Teacher at Maple Avenue Middle School
  • Danielle Bedard, Parent/guardian representative for Maple Avenue  Middle School
  • Lisa Palmer, Parent/guardian representative for Maple Avenue  Middle School
  • Wendy Mahaney, Parent/guardian representative for Maple Avenue  Middle School
  • Daniel Packard, Principal at Caroline Street Elementary School
  • Dana Bush, Principal at Division Street Elementary School 
  • Maureen Agostinello, Teacher at Division Street Elementary School 
  • Peter Hommel, Teacher’s Assistant at Division Street Elementary School 
  • Courtney Jablonski, Principal at Dorothy Nolan Elementary School 
  • Karen Horn-Jansen, Parent/guardian representative for Dorothy Nolan Elementary School 
  • Rebecca Hughes, Assistant Principal at Dorothy Nolan Elementary School
  • Laura Baker, Teacher’s Aide at Dorothy Nolan Elementary School and
  • Parent/guardian representative for Saratoga Springs High School
  • Cody Conley, Principal at Geyser Road Elementary School 
  • Tina Davis, Principal at Greenfield Elementary School 
  • Derek Bull, Teacher at Greenfield Elementary School 
  • Elizabeth Carroll, Principal at Lake Avenue Elementary School 
  • Michael Famiano, Head Custodian at Lake Avenue Elementary School 
  • Amy Elsworth, Teacher at Lake Avenue Elementary School
  • Tara Wright, Teacher at Lake Avenue Elementary School
  • Erin Leary, Parent/guardian representative for Lake Avenue Elementary School
  • Andrew Bowd, Community Volunteer
  • William Jones, Community Volunteer
  • Ray O’Conor, Community Volunteer
  • Jared Dinsmore, Community Volunteer
